intro: Pagameopsis, commonly known as the false holly or pagameopsis holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ericaceae. It is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers that are often white or pink in color. The plant typically grows in acidic soils and prefers shaded to partially shaded environments. It is native to regions of the southeastern United States and parts of Mexico. Pagameopsis species are valued for their ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in woodland gardens.
